The analyzer incorrectly flagged markdown code fences (```typescript```) as shell backtick execution, YAML frontmatter (---) as weak cryptographic algorithms, and documentation section headers as system reconnaissance. The Python scripts contain only standard library imports (os, sys, json, argparse, pathlib, typing) with benign file write operations for report generation. No malicious code, credential exfiltration, or command injection patterns exist.

content.value_statement: Design complex software systems with confidence. Get automated architecture diagrams, dependency analysis, and technology recommendations based on your specific requirements and constraints.
actual_capabilities: Generate architecture diagrams from project structure analysis
Analyze dependencies and identify coupling issues
Provide technology stack recommendations for new projects
Evaluate system design trade-offs and scalability patterns
Document integration patterns between system components
Identify architecture anti-patterns and improvement opportunities
limitations: Does not execute or modify existing code in your project
Does not provision cloud resources or infrastructure
Does not generate complete production-ready code implementations
Recommendations are based on general best practices, not project-specific context

use_cases.title: System Documentation

prompt_templates.title: New Project Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a scalable architecture for a TYPE application with REQUIREMENTS. Consider CONSTRAINTS.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this architecture design DESCRIPTION and identify potential issues with scalability, security, and maintainability.

prompt_templates.title: Tech Stack Advice
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend an appropriate tech stack for a USE CASE requiring REQUIREMENTS including database, backend framework, and frontend.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern Selection
prompt_templates.prompt: Which architectural patterns are best for SCENARIO and how should COMPONENTS communicate with each other?

output_examples.input: Design a scalable microservices architecture for an e-commerce platform handling 10M users
output: Recommended patterns: API Gateway, Service Mesh, Event-Driven Communication
Database strategy: Sharded PostgreSQL for transactions, Redis for caching, Elasticsearch for search
Scaling approach: Horizontal pod autoscaling with circuit breaker patterns
Key considerations: Distributed tracing, eventual consistency, saga pattern for transactions

output_examples.input: Compare GraphQL vs REST for a real-time collaborative application
output: GraphQL advantages: Strong typing, flexible queries, reduces over-fetching
REST advantages: Caching efficiency, simpler caching, widespread tooling
Recommendation: Hybrid approach with GraphQL for complex queries, REST for simple operations
Real-time needs: Consider WebSocket subscriptions alongside REST/GraphQL

output_examples.input: How should we structure a monorepo for a fullstack TypeScript application
output: Recommended structure: apps/, packages/, tools/, docs/ directories
Shared packages: UI components, utilities, API clients, types
Build strategy: Turborepo or Nx for efficient incremental builds
Testing approach: Unit in packages, integration in apps, E2E for critical paths

best_practices: Define clear boundaries between system components before designing integration points
Document architectural decisions with their trade-offs and reasoning
Validate scalability assumptions through capacity planning and load testing
anti_patterns: Avoid premature optimization without measurable performance requirements
Do not create overly complex abstraction layers that hide necessary complexity
Avoid tight coupling between services without clear boundaries and contracts

faq.question: Does this skill write code to my project?
faq.answer: No. The skill analyzes and provides recommendations. It does not modify your codebase.

faq.question: Can it generate complete systems?
faq.answer: It provides architecture patterns and guidance, not complete production-ready implementations.

faq.question: Does it support cloud deployments?
faq.answer: It provides cloud architecture recommendations but does not provision resources.

faq.question: What languages does it support?
faq.answer: TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Go, Swift, Kotlin, and others commonly used in enterprise systems.

faq.question: How does it analyze dependencies?
faq.answer: It examines package.json, requirements.txt, go.mod, and other dependency manifests to identify coupling.

faq.question: Can it review my existing architecture?
faq.answer: Yes. Describe your current architecture and it will identify improvements and anti-patterns.
